Mr Michael Gove said the programme had been beset by massive overspends, tragic delays, botched construction projects and needless bureaucracy . The axe fell on projects for more than 700 schools, provoking uproar from councils, unions and Labour politicians, who warned it was a tragedy and would have a catastrophic effect on pupils.
